Class: GameObject

core/GameObject~ GameObject

new GameObject(id, update, position, rotation, scale)

The main build block of the engine. Create the game classes by inheriting from the Game Object. For quick creation of GOs, it is also possible to use composition.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
id String Identifier. Not mandatory, but recommended
update function The object logic. Not necessary if using inheritance
position THREE.Vector3 Initial position
rotation THREE.Vector3 Initial rotation
scale THREE.Vector3 Initial scale
Source:
  • core/GameObject.js, line 8
Example
// Composition
var myGO = new m.GameObject( myGOId, myGOUpdateFunction );

// Inheritance
var MyGOClass = function( id ) {
 m.GameObject.call( this, id );
};
MyGOClass.prototype = Object.create( m.GameObject.prototype );
MyGOClass.prototype.update = function() { ... };

Members

axis :THREE.Vector3

Axis with Y flipped to calculate properly according to the engine orthographic camera.
Type:
  • THREE.Vector3
Default Value:
  • THREE.Vector3( 0, -1, 0 );

id :String|string

The Game Object id, used to recover the GO instance wherever necessary. Recommended to be explicitly set.
Type:
  • String | string
Default Value:
  • uid
Source:
  • core/GameObject.js, line 41

isActive :boolean

Controls if this Game Object will be updated on engine cycle.
Type:
  • boolean

Controls if this Game Object will be rendered on canvas.

uid :string

Source:
  • core/GameObject.js, line 32

Methods

(abstract) update()

Method to be overridden when inheriting from Game Object. It is called on every engine cycle, making it the place to put specific logic.
Source:
  • core/GameObject.js, line 137
